snippet: According to a complaint in a lawsuit settled this week, Beth Israel Medical Center began fraudulently increasing charges for services to Medicare patients in the late 1990s.
abstract: Beth Israel Medical Center admits that it fraudulently inflated its fees for services to Medicare patients, deliberately deceiving the federal government into paying millions of dollars more than their treatments actually cost; agrees to pay the United States government more than $13 million in damages.
lead_paragraph: According to a complaint in a lawsuit settled this week, Beth Israel Medical Center began fraudulently increasing charges for services to Medicare patients in the late 1990s.

headline.seo: Beth Israel Admits Inflating Fees for Medicare Patients
headline.main: Beth Israel to Pay $13 Million for Inflating Medicare Fees
